Gasparilla Music Fest 2025 Postponed - Gasparilla Music Festival Past Lineups 2024 Lineup 2024 Kids Fest 2023 Lineup 2022 Lineup 2022 Kids Fest 2021 Lineup 2020 Lineup GMF KIDS FEST 2024 2019 Lineup 2018 Lineup 2017 Lineup 2016 Lineup 2015 Lineup 2014 Lineup 2013 Lineup 2012 Lineup Higher Ground FAQ Eating at GMF Accommodations AREA Downtown Tampa Parking & Transportation Festival Map Festival Map Food Beverage Patrons With Disabilities ABOUT About GMF Recycled Tunes Board of Directors GMF Captains Ring of Fire 2024 HG Members 2024 Sponsors CONNECT Contact Us Subscribe Social Media Gasparilla Music Fest 2025 Postponed To our valued Gasparilla Music Festival supporters, It’s with heavy hearts that we share some unfortunate news regarding this year’s Gasparilla Music Festival. After careful consideration and many difficult conversations, we have decided to postpone this year’s February date due to the ongoing financial strain caused by two consecutive years of extreme weather conditions that were beyond our control. This decision was not made lightly, as we understand the immense impact this has on our community, the artists, our GMF staff, and the many individuals who look forward to GMF each year. However, in an effort to preserve the long-term health of our nonprofit foundation and ensure that we can continue to provide a vibrant and meaningful cultural experience in the years ahead, we believe this is the best course of action. The challenges of the past two years have put a tremendous financial strain on our Foundation, and by choosing to recoup our losses now, we aim to protect our ability to produce a high-quality event that you and our community can be proud of. We are committed to using this time to re-evaluate, recover, and begin planning for our next exciting and successful festival. We want to express our deep appreciation for the unwavering support the City of Tampa and surrounding Tampa Bay community has shown us throughout the years. Your dedication to GMF means the world to us, and we remain grateful for the opportunity to bring people together to celebrate the love of music. We’ve already begun processing ticket refunds, and you we hope to have those completed in the next 7-14 days. If you have any questions or need assistance, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us. Thank you once again for the tremendous continued support. We look forward to brighter days ahead and to coming together for the next spectacular Gasparilla Music Festival in the near future. With gratitude, The Gasparilla Music Festival Team Gasparilla Music Festival – Tampa's Music Fest TWITTER Tweets by GasparillaMusic VOLUNTEER SPONSOR INFO VENDOR INFO PRESS CONTACT To become a Volunteer for GMF 2025, SIGN UP HERE For more information, please contact, volunteers@gasparillamusic.com . About - Gasparilla Music Festival Past Lineups 2024 Lineup 2024 Kids Fest 2023 Lineup 2022 Lineup 2022 Kids Fest 2021 Lineup 2020 Lineup GMF KIDS FEST 2024 2019 Lineup 2018 Lineup 2017 Lineup 2016 Lineup 2015 Lineup 2014 Lineup 2013 Lineup 2012 Lineup Higher Ground FAQ Eating at GMF Accommodations AREA Downtown Tampa Parking & Transportation Festival Map Festival Map Food Beverage Patrons With Disabilities ABOUT About GMF Recycled Tunes Board of Directors GMF Captains Ring of Fire 2024 HG Members 2024 Sponsors CONNECT Contact Us Subscribe Social Media About GMF The Gasparilla Music Foundation is a Florida 501(c)-3 non-profit corporation that organizes an annual music festival in Tampa and supports music education through its Recycled Tunes program. The 2025 festival takes place in Julian B Lane Riverfront Park on Feb 14-16, featuring musical acts from a wide variety of genres on several stages and cuisine from the region’s top restaurants. As part of its mission to support and promote music and education, the organization operates throughout the year providing scholarships and instruments to music students and paid performance opportunities for local musicians. The Gasparilla Music Foundation was founded in 2011 with financial support from many Tampa Bay area based businesses and the organization’s founding members, The Ring of Fire . The organizations goals include: Creating a long-term sustainable institution benefiting the Tampa bay area Support and Promote local musicians and bands Support and Promote local cuisine and beverages Provide support and financial assistance for music education Contribute to the economic development of the region Contribute to the neighborhood rejuvenation of the city’s urban core Promote the region’s cultural heritage Minimize the environmental impacts of festival production Promote public and alternative methods of transportation TWITTER Tweets by GasparillaMusic VOLUNTEER SPONSOR INFO VENDOR INFO PRESS CONTACT To become a Volunteer for GMF 2025, SIGN UP HERE For more information, please contact, volunteers@gasparillamusic.com . Gasparilla Music Festival will move to new location in 2024; tickets go on sale next week Search query Search the web Skip to main News Finance Sports More -1 Manage your account Help Add or switch accounts Sign out Search the web Advertisement Advertisement Return to Homepage Top Stories: Charlie Kirk fatally shot Who was Charlie Kirk? Ellison surpasses Musk Pandemic pups Trump on N.C. train stabbing Harris on Biden's decision to run Trump barred from firing Lisa Cook Trump: Epstein note a 'dead issue' 2 Americans fly to Tunisia by mistake 'Phillies Karen' viral drama WFLA Gasparilla Music Festival will move to new location in 2024; tickets go on sale next week Athina Morris Fri, December 1, 2023 at 10:24 PM UTC 1 min read TAMPA, Fla. (WFLA) — The Gasparilla Music Festival will move from its previous home at Curtis Hixon Park to a location just across the Hillsborough River. Julian B. Lane Park will host the festival, which is entering its 13th year and is expected to attract thousands over three days, Friday, Feb. 16 through Sunday, Feb. 18. Breakaway Music Festival to kick off 2024 multi-city tour in Tampa. Here’s how to get tickets Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement “We are very excited with all of the new opportunities this new venue is providing us to grow and take our festival experience to a whole new level,” said David Cox, Executive Director of the Gasparilla Music Foundation. “And with the help of our community partners, we are proud to still be able to offer affordable presale tickets out to our loyal fans.” File video: Saxophonist Marlon Boone joins Gayle to give us a taste of the Soul by the Bay Music Festival. In the past, GMF has taken place at Curtis Hixon and was headlined by acts like Nas,  Brandi Carlile, The Avett Brothers and The Roots. This year, there will be 50 bands performing on five stages. The lineup is set to be revealed in the coming weeks. Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Window to the Weekend: Soul by the Bay Music Festival From 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. Sunday, the festival will have its own Kids Fest, which will feature an interactive zone and family-friendly performances. A limited amount of discounted early bird tickets will go on sale Tuesday, Dec. 5 at 10 a.m. on www.gmftickets.com. The presale ticket prices are: GA 2-DAY EB (Fri/Sat) $60.00 GA 2-DAY EB (Sat/Sun) $60.00 GA 3-Day EB $75.00 VIP 2-DAY EB (Fri/Sat) $150.00 VIP 2-Day EB (Sat/Sun) $150.00 VIP 3-Day EB $200.00 For the latest news, weather, sports, and streaming video, head to WFLA. FAQ - Gasparilla Music Festival GASPARILLA MUSIC FESTIVAL HOME FAQ FAQ Below is a list of our Frequently Asked Questions. What is Gasparilla Music Festival? The Gasparilla Music Festival (“GMF”) is a community-funded festival celebrating the arts in Tampa Bay by showcasing diverse local acts alongside nationally recognized headliners. GMF is organized by the Gasparilla Music Foundation, a Florida 501(c)3 non-profit corporation. Our mission is to create a sustainable community event for the Tampa Bay area while promoting arts education and benefiting local organizations and businesses. Find out more about some of our community outreach HERE . When and where? March 10-11, 2018! Curtis Hixon Waterfront Park, Kiley Gardens Park Downtown Tampa 600 N Ashley Drive Tampa, Florida 33602 How can I volunteer to help out at GMF? The Gasparilla Music Festival is completely grassroots and volunteer run. There are many options available for volunteers, and you will be joining a fun and energetic team. Please check here for volunteer opportunities for GMF 2018! How can I become a sponsor? GMF is a not-profit organization that hosts a community funded music festival sponsored by individuals and corporate sponsors. Your support is greatly appreciated and there are several levels of opportunities designed to fit your company’s needs and budget. Please call GMF at (813) 708-8423 or email GMF at sponsors@gasparillamusic.com to learn how you can become a part of history! How can I submit my band to play at GMF 2018? Please contact talent@gasparillamusic.com for more information and check back for 2018 submission information! What Bands/Artists are playing at the 2018 Gasparilla Music Festival? Please see our Lineup page for full artist lineup. When and where do the artists perform? The 2018 lineup is now available HERE ! However the schedule has not been announced yet. Keep a lookout for lineup updates HERE . When will tickets for the 2018 GMF go on sale? General admission & VIP tickets for the 2018 Gasparilla Music Festival are available HERE . How much do tickets cost? General admission & VIP tickets for GMF 2018 are now available HERE . Ticket pricing for GMF 2018 are reflected below: All ticket holders will be issued a wristband on Day One of event. If wristband is removed, you will not be issued a replacement. Re-entry will be at full price. Ticket and entry are voided if wristband is removed. How can I purchase tickets? Tickets for the 2018 Gasparilla Music Festival are available HERE . Are VIP Tickets available? VIP are currently on sale HERE . Please see our VIP Ticket Page for more information. What is included in the VIP Experience? Three complimentary beverages Front of stage viewing areas at the Curtis Hixon Park, Kiley Gardens Access to all VIP Tents Re-entry into the festival Exclusive VIP entrance to the festival Air conditioned restrooms Please see our VIP Ticket Page for more information. What type of food will be at 2018 GMF? GMF exclusively features local restaurants. Food offerings for GMF 2018 have not yet been determined. Please check back for 2018 food vendors announcement HERE . Is GMF “kid-friendly”? Yes, particularly early in the day. We have a number of activities planned for children. Children 12 years of age and under gain free admission. How do I get to the Gasparilla Music Festival? Check out our Getting Here page for information. Is the festival accessible for those with disabilities? Yes. There will be a drop off area in Gasparilla Plaza and the adjacent Poe Garage should have sufficient parking options. There are two designated viewing areas at the festival. Please contact us info@gasparillamusic.com for assistance Where can I stay? Check out our Accommodations page for information Will there be ATMs at the festival? Yes. Please see Venue Map for locations. Where do I park? Hourly parking is available in the Poe Garage, Curtis Hixon Garage and Fort Brooke Garage. Street parking meters north of Kennedy Blvd are free on weekends. Please see our Parking and Transportation page for more information. Where do I enter? General Admission Gate 1 On the Ashley St side of Curtis Hixon Park, just north of the big fountain. General Admission Gate 2 On the Ashley St side of Kiley Gardens Park, by the valet drop off for Malio’s and the River Gate Tower (Sykes Building). This entrance services volunteer, vendors, and media VIP Ticket Holder Entrance Northeast side of Curtis Hixon Park across from the kid’s play area. Sponsor/Higher Ground Ticket Holder Entrance North side of Curtis Hixon, between the Children’s Museum and the Museum of Art. Can I purchase GMF tickets at the event? Yes if there are still tickets available! There will be a box office on Saturday and Sunday. We will accept cash or credit card. What can I bring? GMF approved items include: Blanket or ground tarp (no larger than 6’x8′) Low-backed chairs (under 30″ in height, permitted in designated areas only) Small bags and backpacks (smaller than 17″x12″x10″, subject to search) Water (factory sealed, up to 1 liter) Wheelchairs and medical scooters Strollers for children Hand-held still cameras OK, so what items are NOT permitted? Please leave the following items at home: Alcohol (we will provide on-site) and other beverages (except sealed water up to 1 liter or an empty reusable, non-glass container) Glass containers Coolers and thermoses Flag Poles & Flags Umbrellas and tents (anything that can obstruct the view of others) Large chairs Video and audio recording equipment Pets Wagons, skateboards and Segways Weapons, illicit drugs and other contraband Balls, frisbees, missiles, and any other types of throwing objects or projectiles Are there any additional policies? No unauthorized vending. GMF reserves the right to deny entry or remove from the festival anyone in violation of these policies. Can I bring my pet? We love our furry friends, but we request that you please leave pets at home. Do you accommodate bike riders? We sure do! Please check our Parking and Transportation page! Is photographic or recording equipment permitted at the festival? Hand-held still cameras are permitted. Tripods are not advisable. Audio and video recording devices are NOT permitted. How can I gain credentials for a press pass? Please send your contact information to pr@gasparillamusic.com along with link to your publication and related media. CURTIS HIXON PARK & KILEY GARDENS TAMPA, FLORIDA

Frequently Asked Questions - Gasparilla Music Festival Past Lineups 2024 Lineup 2024 Kids Fest 2023 Lineup 2022 Lineup 2022 Kids Fest 2021 Lineup 2020 Lineup GMF KIDS FEST 2024 2019 Lineup 2018 Lineup 2017 Lineup 2016 Lineup 2015 Lineup 2014 Lineup 2013 Lineup 2012 Lineup Higher Ground FAQ Eating at GMF Accommodations AREA Downtown Tampa Parking & Transportation Festival Map Festival Map Food Beverage Patrons With Disabilities ABOUT About GMF Recycled Tunes Board of Directors GMF Captains Ring of Fire 2024 HG Members 2024 Sponsors CONNECT Contact Us Subscribe Social Media Frequently Asked Questions Below is a list of our Frequently Asked Questions. What is Gasparilla Music Festival? The Gasparilla Music Festival (“GMF”) is a community-funded festival celebrating the arts in Tampa Bay by showcasing diverse local acts alongside nationally recognized headliners. GMF is organized by the Gasparilla Music Foundation, a Florida 501(c)3 non-profit corporation. Our mission is to create a sustainable community event for the Tampa Bay area while promoting arts education and benefiting local organizations and businesses. Find out more about some of our community outreach HERE . For a look at some of the local sights, sounds and flavors of our festival can be found HERE . How do I obtain my refund for the 2025 festival that is postponed? We have already begun processing refunds for all of the tickets purchased for the 2025 festival that was to take place February 14-16. We anticipate all refunds being complete within 7-14 business days.  Please check the account where the purchase was made and if you have not received your refund in that period, please contact us. When and where? The 2025 Festival has been postponed and new dates to be announced Location: Julian B Lane Riverfront Park 1001 N Boulevard Tampa, FL 33607 When is GMF 2025? The 2025 Festival has been postponed and new dates to be announced Where can I stay? See our Accommodations page. What days and times do the bands perform? Lineup and Schedule to be announced. All Bands, Dates and Times are Subject to Change or Cancellation How can I volunteer to help out at GMF? The Gasparilla Music Festival is completely grassroots and volunteer run. There are many options available for volunteers, and you will be joining a fun and energetic team. Please check here for volunteer opportunities for GMF! How can I become a sponsor? GMF is a not-profit organization that hosts a community funded music festival sponsored by individuals and corporate sponsors. Your support is greatly appreciated and there are several levels of opportunities designed to fit your company’s needs and budget. Please email GMF at sponsors@gasparillamusic.com to learn how you can become a part of history! How much do tickets cost? Tickets are currently not on sale How can I purchase tickets? Tickets are currently not on sale When will tickets for the 2025 GMF go on sale? Tickets are currently not on sale How much are VIP tickets? Tickets are currently not on sale What is included in the VIP and VIP+ Experiences? VIP Tickets include: 2 FREE Specialty Cocktails per day Commemorative VIP Badge VIP Entrances into the Festival VIP premium viewing at the Riverside Stage and the Fortune Stage Front of stage viewing at the Riverside Stage and the Fortune Stage. Dedicated VIP bar & tent at the Riverside Stage and the Fortune Stage Exclusive, air-conditioned and attended restrooms VIP+ Tickets include: Access to the River Center which includes complimentary cocktails, food, air conditioning and restrooms Commemorative VIP+ Badge VIP Entrances into the Festival VIP premium viewing at the Riverside Stage and the Fortune Stage Front of stage viewing at the Riverside Stage and the Fortune Stage. Dedicated VIP bar & tent at the Riverside Stage and the Fortune Stage Exclusive, air-conditioned and attended restrooms Each multiple day ticket is for 1 person. All ticket holders will be issued a wristband on Day One of event. If wristband is removed, you will not be issued a replacement. Re-entry will be at full price. Re-entry is allowed once you received your wristband . Ticket and entry are voided if wristband is removed. What Bands / Artists are playing at the 2025 Gasparilla Music Festival? Lineup Announcement TBD All Bands, Dates and Times are Subject to Change or Cancellation What type of food will be at 2025 GMF? 2025 Food Lineup TBD Is GMF cash-less? Yes. GMF accepts credit cards and Apple Pay / Google Pay. Is GMF “kid-friendly”? Children 12 and under get in FREE to GMF! NOTE: While GMF does allow children, there are adult beverages being served and from mid afternoon to evening, it is not recommended for young children. There also may be some music with profanities during those times. How do I get to the Gasparilla Music Festival? Bike to the Fest and use our FREE valet bike valet parking! Rideshare with friends on Uber/Lyft. PRO TIP: Drop off & Pick Up area is along N. Boulevard in front of the tennis courts. Download the DASH app to scooter throughout downtown for an affordable rate. The Pirate Water Taxi will be sailing through the river to the Fest. We’re Stop #15. Pay to park at the Poe Garage that’s a short scenic walk to the Fest! Please be advised that the parking lots just south and north of Julian B. Lane require a special parking pass and are not open to the public. Keep an eye out for limited parking spots close to the park. Directions From I-75 North Use the right 2 lanes to take exit 45A toward Downtown E; Keep left, follow signs for Ashley Dr; Turn right onto W Cass St; Turn right onto N Blvd From I-75 South Use the right lane to take exit 44 toward Downtown; Follow signs for Ashley Dr; Turn right onto W Cass St; Turn right onto N Blvd From I-4 Use the center lane to take exit 45A toward Downtown; Follow signs for Ashley Dr; Turn right onto W Cass St; Turn right onto N Blvd Where do I park? Please be advised that the parking lots just south and north of Julian B. Lane require a special parking pass and are not open to the public. Limited Free Street Parking Julian B. Lane Riverfront Park is adjacent to free street parking just west of the park on residential streets. Street parking is also available on Doyle Carlton Drive which is an approximately 5 min walk to Julian B. Lane. Downtown Parking Garages/Lots Pay to park at the Poe Garage that’s a short scenic walk to the Fest! Various parking lots managed by independent vendors are also located downtown. Do you accommodate bike riders? We sure do! We offer Bike Valet at the tennis courts next the intersection of N Boulevard and W Cypress Street. Is the festival accessible for those with disabilities? Yes. There is a viewing deck for those with disabilities located next to the main stage soundboard at the Riverside Stage. Please contact us info@gasparillamusic.com for assistance Will there be ATMs at the festival? No and cash cannot be used inside the festival. Can I purchase GMF tickets at the event? Yes if there are still tickets available! The Box Office is located at Gate 1 at the intersection of N Boulevard and W Cypress and open 30 minutes prior to Gate Times each day. We accept credit cards only. What can I bring? GMF approved items include: – Blanket or ground tarp (no larger than 6’x8′) – Low-backed chairs (under 30″ in height, not within 100 feet on any stages) – Small bags and backpacks (smaller than 17″x12″x10″, subject to search) – Water (factory sealed, up to 1 liter) – Wheelchairs and medical scooters – Strollers for children – Hand-held still cameras OK, so what items are NOT permitted? Please leave the following items at home: – Alcohol (we will provide on-site) and other beverages (except sealed water up to 1 liter or an empty reusable, non-glass container) – Glass containers – Coolers and thermoses – Food – Umbrellas and tents (anything that can obstruct the view of others) – Large chairs – Video and audio recording equipment – Pets – Wagons, skateboards and Segways – Weapons, illicit drugs and other contraband – Balls, frisbees, missiles, and any other types of throwing objects or projectiles Are there any additional policies? No unauthorized vending, advertising or solicitations. GMF reserves the right to deny entry or remove from the festival anyone in violation of these policies or for any reason. What is the ticket refund policy? All tickets are final sale and cannot be exchanged or refunded. Rain or Shine. All artists, dates and times subject to change or cancellation.  In the case of an event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund may be issued. By purchasing a ticket to this event, you agree to this purchase policy. Before purchasing your tickets, we urge you to confirm the title, time and location of the event. Can I bring my pet? No. We love our furry friends, but we request that you please leave pets at home. How can I submit my band to play at GMF 2025? Currently the 2025 lineup is full. Is photographic or recording equipment permitted at the festival? Hand-held still cameras are permitted. Tripods are not allowed. Audio and video recording devices are NOT permitted. How can I gain credentials for a press pass? Please send your contact information to pr@gasparillamusic.com along with link to your publication and related media. plus applicable taxes and fees All artists and times subject to change or cancellation. Rain or Shine.
